thread.title: Another Republican Challenges New York Governor, Citing Aide’s Conviction

author: Mike Vilensky
title: Another Republican Challenges New York Governor, Citing Aide’s Conviction
text:
A day after a Manhattan jury convicted a former aide to Gov. Andrew Cuomo of public corruption, a new Republican rival said he would challenge the two-term Democratic governor.
Dutchess County Executive Marcus Molinaro, who party leaders have encouraged to run, cited the case against longtime Cuomo confidant Joseph Percoco when he officially declared himself a candidate on Wednesday.
“Yesterday’s... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
